title: Yet another elite UFC fighter is calling Conor McGregor 'irrelevant'
text:
Tony Ferguson, an elite lightweight fighter in the UFC, called Conor McGregor "irrelevant."

The jiu-jitsu specialist's comments to ESPN on Tuesday followed the lightweight champion Khabib Nurmagomedov's statement implying that the Russian wrestler — alongside his opponent Dustin Poirier and the welterweight rivals Jorge Masvidal and Nate Diaz — would freeze McGregor out of the UFC's biggest fights.

In the lightweight division, UFC has Ferguson ranked just behind Poirier and the champion Nurmagomedov, who are set to fight at the UFC 242 event in Abu Dhabi on Saturday.

Ferguson told ESPN that "both these fighters are nervous, it's in a dope-ass arena, and I would have loved to have fought for that title there."

The well-rounded Californian, who's on a 12-fight win streak, said he thinks he will fight the winner of this weekend's Nurmagomedov vs. Poirier bout.

As for McGregor, Ferguson said he might better off fighting celebrities.

"Recently, he was trying to fight Mark Wahlberg," Ferguson said. "Maybe that's the fight for him.

"Dude's got a couple things," he continued. "He's making his money. He's doing his thing. I don't know if he wants to fight anymore. He's not my concern."

Ferguson said that McGregor was "like one of those ex-girlfriends" and that he "stopped worrying about that dude."

Tony Ferguson. Photo by Jeff Bottari/Zuffa LLC/Zuffa LLC via Getty Images

"At first he was in line trying to go for the title, and then once he became irrelevant I stopped caring about the dude. And now he's mentioning my name? Get the f--- out of here, dude. Come on," he said.

"If push comes to shove and then we need to, I mean, I see him fighting the loser of this next fight this weekend," he said, adding: "We are professional. This is what we do. It is the UFC. That's why we have rankings. So me, if I fight for the title next, he's got to fight for the underdog. He wins, and then you know what, maybe I'll give him a shot."
description: Tony Ferguson is next in line to fight for the UFC lightweight title, challenging the winner of Khabib Nurmagomedov vs. Dustin Poirier on Saturday.
